infodynamics.measures.continuous.kernel
Class MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKernel

java.lang.Object
  infodynamics.measures.continuous.MutualInfoMultiVariateCommon
      infodynamics.measures.continuous.kernel.MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKernel
All Implemented Interfaces:
ChannelCalculatorCommon, ChannelCalculatorMultiVariate, MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate, java.lang.Cloneable
public class MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKernel
extends MutualInfoMultiVariateCommon
implements MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate, java.lang.Cloneable

Computes the differential mutual information of two given multivariate sets of observations, using kernel estimation. For more details on kernel estimation for computing probability distribution functions, see Kantz and Schreiber (below).

Usage:

  1. Construct MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKernel()
  2. Set properties using setProperty(String, String)
  3. initialise(int, int) or initialise(int, int, double)
  4. Provide the observations to the calculator using: MutualInfoMultiVariateCommon.setObservations(double[][], double[][]), or #setCovariance(double[][]), or a sequence of: MutualInfoMultiVariateCommon.startAddObservations(), multiple calls to either MutualInfoMultiVariateCommon.addObservations(double[][], double[][]) or MutualInfoMultiVariateCommon.addObservations(double[][], double[][], int, int), and then finaliseAddObservations().
  5. Compute the required information-theoretic results, primarily: computeAverageLocalOfObservations() to return the average MI entropy based on the supplied observations; or other calls to compute local values or statistical significance.

Author:
Joseph Lizier, joseph.lizier at gmail.com
See Also:
"H. Kantz and T. Schreiber, 'Nonlinear Time Series Analysis'. Cambridge, MA: Cambridge University Press, 1997"

finaliseAddObservations

public void finaliseAddObservations()
Description copied from class: MutualInfoMultiVariateCommon
Finalise the addition of multiple observation sets. This default implementation simply puts all of the observations into the MutualInfoMultiVariateCommon.sourceObservations and MutualInfoMultiVariateCommon.destObservations arrays. Usually child implementations will override this, call this implementation to perform the common processing, then perform their own processing.

Specified by:
finaliseAddObservations in interface ChannelCalculatorCommon
Overrides:
finaliseAddObservations in class MutualInfoMultiVariateCommon

public double[] computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations(double[][] states1,
                                                      double[][] states2)
Compute the local MI values for these given values, using the previously provided observations to compute the probabilities. Calls to this method will not harness dynamic correlation exclusion (if set) since we don't know whether it's the same time set or not.

setProperty

public void setProperty(java.lang.String propertyName,
                        java.lang.String propertyValue)
                 throws java.lang.Exception

Set properties for the mutual information calculator. These can include:

  • KERNEL_WIDTH_PROP_NAME (legacy value is EPSILON_PROP_NAME)
  • NORMALISE_PROP_NAME
  • DYN_CORR_EXCL_TIME_NAME
  • FORCE_KERNEL_COMPARE_TO_ALL
or any properties set in MutualInfoMultiVariateCommon.setProperty(String, String).

Note that dynamic correlation exclusion (set with DYN_CORR_EXCL_TIME_NAME) may have unexpected results if multiple observation sets have been added. This is because multiple observation sets are treated as though they are from a single time series, so observations from near the end of observation set i will be excluded from comparison to observations near the beginning of observation set (i+1).

Specified by:
setProperty in interface ChannelCalculatorCommon
Overrides:
setProperty in class MutualInfoMultiVariateCommon
Parameters:
propertyName -
propertyValue -
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if there is a problem with the supplied value

clone

protected java.lang.Object clone()
                          throws java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
Clone the object - note: while it does create new cloned instances of the KernelEstimatorMultiVariate objects, I think these only have shallow copies to the data. This is enough though to maintain the structure across various MutualInfoMultiVariateCommon.computeSignificance(int) calls.
